item.title: Kubernetes networking | Network Namespace, veth and bridge
item.description: Kubernetes guarantees that each pod in the cluster has a unique IP address, and they can can communicate with each other using this IP address directly. You may wonder how this is achieved. We will have a series of posts that will explain how networking works in Kubernetes. And this is the first post in the series, which will explain three fundamental concepts: network namespace, veth, and bridge, that are the building blocks of Kubernetes (and container) networking.
